content_sections.title: Section 1
content_sections.content:
W3.CSS Validation

CSS Validation
The W3C CSS Validation Service can be used to check the correctness (validity) of W3.CSS.
The Validation Service
was created by the W3C to help Web developers
validate CSS.
Validation Warnings
The W3C CSS Validator checks for CSS1, CSS2, CSS3, and CSS4 properties.
Some 
browsers use
vendor extensions
to simulate CSS3 and CSS4 
properties.
Vendor extensions can create warnings in the W3 CSS validation prosess.
Vendor Extensions
W3.CSS uses
vendor extensions
to support older browsers.
Browser vendors are working to stop using prefixes in future browser 
versions.
Until then, some extensions will have to be used to make modern CSS work in 
all browsers.
